results.title: Fakes and drives
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basketball Skills”.
One in a series of films on basketball skills, giving instruction and demonstration of basketball techniques, including slow-motion action and training routines. Narrated by Ron Pickering.

results.title: Faithless = Trolosa [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Ingmar Bergman, Liv Ullman, Kaj Larsen, YLE, Sf Norge As, Ab Svensk Film Industri and SVT Drama
results.brief_description: Liv Ullman, best known for her acting in iconic films by Ingmar Bergman, directs “Faithless”, from a script by Bergman. “Faithless” is the story of a bourgeois Swedish family whose lives are put asunder by an extra-marital affair. Marianne (Lena Andre) is happily married to composer Markus (Thomas Hanzon), living with their young daughter, Isabelle. David (Krister Henriksson), a friend to both Marianne and Markus, is a hapless writer and theatre director, onto his troubled second marriage, and a frequent visitor to the family home. David is depicted as a charming rogue with a self-destructive streak, filled with self-loathing. One night, when Markus is away on tour, David proposes to Marianne that they sleep together. Marianne refuses but her interest is piqued and the sanctity of her family unit is doomed. Told in extended flashback sequences, Marianne relays her story to the narrator, Bergman (Erland Josephson), who listens patiently, coercing Marianne to confess her indiscretions. This set-up, at a beautiful, remote beachside retreat, is reminiscent of many Ingmar Bergman films, in particular “Persona”. “Faithless” employs a leisurely pace to unfurl this tale of morality, betrayal, love and revenge, between three consenting adults and an innocent child. In Swedish with English subtitles.

results.title: Faithful departed
results.creator_credit: Kieran Hickey, Des Hickey and B.A.C. Films Ltd (Ireland)
results.brief_description: Life in Dublin in the early years of the 20th Century as shown in selected contemporary photographs. Discusses James Joyce’s early life and shows the setting of his novel Ulysses in the city as he knew it. Commentary by Jack MacGowran.

results.title: Faith the fax
results.brief_description: A platypus and his mate discuss the advantages of communicating with God. The platypus convinces his friend that forecasts from God via fax are essential for averting danger.

results.title: Faites Sauter la Banque = Rob the Bank
results.brief_description:
Garnier, a shopkeeper, gets taken advantage of by a local banker, Durand-Mareuil. Having lost everything on the stock exchange, he decides to get his money back by digging a tunnel under the bank all the way to the safes.

Credits: Producer, Raymond Danon ; director, Jean Girault ; writers, Jacques Girault, Jacques Vilfrid, Louis Sapin ; photography, Andre Germain ; music, Paul Mauriat.
Cast: Louis de Funes, Jean-Pierre Marielle, Anne Doat, Yvonne Clech, Claude Pieplu, Catherine Demongeot, Georges Wilson.

results.title: Fairytales and Fantasy Workshops: Carlton North Primary 18 July 2005: Groups A and B
results.brief_description:
Fairy Tales and Fantasy is an ACMI screen education program designed to encourage students to begin to develop an appreciation for the art and the craft behind moving image in its many forms, by developing their ability to think beyond the screen. Fairy Tales and Fantasy aims to develop students’ understanding of ways in which film-makers create screen texts. Students in Years 1-2 learn about:
- three key stages of plot development
- main elements of the fairy tale genre
- simple concepts related to camera use such as framing, shot types, angles
- the magic of blue-screen technology
- become actors in a short film during a blue-screen workshop that allows them to place themselves in a magical, fairy tale setting
- engage with a film program featuring traditional and non-traditional fairy tales, and participate in a related discussion
- learn some simple editing skills while they create a fairy tale story
- view their ACMI creations.
Fairy Tales and Fantasy and activities provided in the accompanying Teacher Kit are designed to assist students to develop a range of Screen Literacy outcomes. The program is also designed to assist students to develop understandings about the ways in which stories help us to make sense of the world and our place in that world. People all over the world tell stories in many different ways using oral, written and visual texts. This program and related activities enables students to share their experiences of story and to extend and refine their understandings by comparing a range of fairy tale and fantasy texts, analysing narrative structure and exploring animation and film adaptations of fairy tales.

results.title: Fairy tale: a true story
results.creator_credit: Charles Sturridge, Bruce Davey, Wendy Finerman and Anna K Productions
results.brief_description: In 1917 two English girls, Elise Wright and Frances Griffiths photographed fairies in their garden. These photographs became known as the Cottingley photographs, eponymous from the village where the girls lived. This led to the often asked question, “do fairies exist?”. This event led to a nation wide search for the truth, led by two personalities of the day, Harry Houdini (Harvey Keitel), and Sir Arthur Conan Doyle (Peter O’Toole). Although this film is based on a true event; the existence of the photographs, the film’s ending does differ from the truth that eventuated much later. A magical tale that will enchant viewers of all ages. Cast includes Florence Hoath, Elizabeth Earl, Paul McGann and Phoebe Nicholls.
